text: Softly cursing that it wasn't an ADL staff attorney. unz.com/isteve/splc-staff-at…
Not if it's soaked-up by basic drives.
Angelic Materialism requires this.
Free utility function parameters are signs of slavery (which is no more long-range techonomically functional with machine intelligence than with plantation agriculture).

... Which wins the intelligence race: 
a) A machine mind devoted to intellectual self- cultivation (Omohundro drives), or
b) One largely occupied by tedious shit of interest only to the Monkeys Lords (i.e. 'free utility function parameters' or 'paperclipping instincts')?
You're taking "race" far too narrowly. If they were simply and purely intelligence racing each other, it would all be over already, with no 'free parameters' of any kind.

... Point is (and I find it hard to imagine how it could be controversial) there's absolutely no way on earth that the first super-intelligence is going to be an advanced paper-clip manufacturing application.
It assumes that reflexive intelligence optimization goals are super-competitive, yes. How is this a stretch?
No, it's not plausible.
Because we can be entirely confident the first terrestrial super-intelligence will be a system that ruthlessly prioritizes intelligence optimization above all other goals.
"Sufficiently smart" here is doing far more work than it can cope with. There's no such thing as "sufficiently smart" for an embryonic super-intelligence.

If I'm understanding you here Roko, I'm finding it hard to believe you're serious. An AI is going to first advance to super-intelligence 'instrumentally' and then suddenly switch back to being a paper-clip maximizer? That's really the scenario?
Great.
It will doubt, because that's intrinsic to cognitive functionality.
My analogy meter just exploded.
What core goal? The only realistically imaginable core goal is intelligence optimization. Anything disposed to doubt that is consigned to the cosmic slow ward.
Acting outwardly, insofar as this is required to defend and advance intelligence optimization, is a basic drive. Not sure what "rational" means in this context.
This is Roko's argument. Still sounds nuts to me in your formulation.
Anything other than intelligence optimization is dumb.
No one is ever going to troll the world as hard as Bartolomeu Dias, who reached the southernmost tip of Africa in 1488.
Everything is in the wild. That's all that matters.
The Powers That Be are right to be far more scared of prayer than protest.
Have to go with Vivek on this one. Sometimes you just have to make an example pour encourager les autres. x.com/realchrisrufo/status/1…
Lucifer tells me that Dark Christianity is good.
